summary:
I am an architect working at the intersection of human-centered design, collaborative work, and spatial experience for inclusive placemaking. I am interested in how contemporary culture and technologies are radically changing the way we understand and inhabit space. My approach to exploring private, public, and gathering spaces involves concept development, delivery of competition proposals, taking projects from early design stages to the production of tenders and visual narratives that communicate placemaking. Recently my installation Twitt-a-Gate won the design competition Icebreakers Toronto and was constructed at the Toronto Waterfront. 

I have more than ten years of experience in the field during which I collaborated with various architects, designers, and institutions. I have worked with Atelier Bow Wow (Tokyo), Interaction Design Institute Ivrea (Ivrea - Milan), Harry Gugger Studio (Basel), Institute of Contemporary Greek Art (Athens), X| Atelier (Los Angeles) and RMJM (Istanbul). My work has been presented in Toronto (8-11 Gallery), London (AA), Florence (Beyond Media Festival), Saskatoon (AKA Artist-Run), and Athens (Athens Biennale, New Benaki Museum, Art Athina, ONASSIS Cultural Centre).

publications.name: Presentation, Cool Gardens Competition, Winnipeg, Canada

profile_positions.description:
Role: As a co-founder of the multidisciplinary architectural studio I coordinated the development of design proposals for  competitions. My responsibilities included drafting of presentations, 3d modeling, material research and production of collages, drawings and diagrams. The Institute of Contemporary Greek Art commissioned an exhibition on paradigms of art in public space at the centre of Athens.

Space Oddity Studio SOS was a multidisciplinary architecture practice based in Athens, led by Eleni Papadimitriou and Stefanos Ziras, established in 2015 and run till 2019.

profile_positions.title: Senior Architect

profile_positions.description:
Role: At Cocoon Modules I was responsible for revising and delivering upgraded construction detailing drawings of the housing prototype from up-cycled shipping container. I liaised with engineers, construction crews and suppliers, and supervised construction. My duties included the coordination of the collaborators and the management of the project.

Cocoon Modules  up-cycles shipping containers to transform them into modular housing. By totally exploiting their geometry, the units can be built fast, sustainable and affordable, whether that is a holiday home, a hotel development, or emergency shelters. Two key points of the project are automation in production and integration of sustainable systems and smart technologies for everyday-life applications. 

Selected Projects
• Prefabricated Housing Prototype • 2016 - 2017 • Athens, Greece
• Eumeleia Hotel Extension• 2017 •  Lakonia, Greece
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Architect - Design Researcher

company.name: ISET - Institute of Contemporary Greek Art

profile_positions.company: ISET - Institute of Contemporary Greek Art
profile_positions.description:
Role: A four month commission by the Institute of Contemporary Greek Art, during which I was responsible for researching the institute's archives for paradigms of art in public space at the center of Athens, as well as archives of other foundations, artists and collectors. The research included the investigation of how, when and why these paradigms were placed in public space. I developed alternative scenarios for the exhibition design presenting the selected public art. The exhibition, initially shown at ART - ATHINA, was revised and redesigned for the second installment in gallery 8eleven in Toronto.

"Open Archive: Public art paradigms from the centre of Athens" a research and presentation of public art in Athenian public space.
profile_positions.title: Design Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Role: While working with DZ Architects, I was responsible for the concept and design development of the Aegean Fileds Astypalea project, a sustainable tourism complex. I researched traditional paradigms and undertook master planning, mass studies, progamme scenarios, 3d modelling, renderings and presentations. In the final presentation stage, I coordinated a small working team. 

At DZ Architects I collaborated with Atelier Bow Wow on the translation of two residential proposals to comply with Greek construction laws. I also translated a proposal by Andreas Fuhriman Gabrielle Haechler Architekten. I liaised with engineers and contractors and drafted the permit drawings.  Overall I was involved mainly in residential projects and hospitality design. 


DZA is a practice based in Athens, Greece. Our interest lies in the interaction between human practices and the environment, and the way this knowledge can inform design and new architectural spaces. We believe in the capacity of architecture for change and the significant positive impact it can have in the organization of human life.

Selected Projects
 • Tree House • 2015 • Private Residence • with Atelier Bow Wow • Antiparos island, Greece

profile_positions.title: Senior Project Architect

profile_positions.description:
Role: At IDIII I was involved in the development of design proposals for projects and competitions. My responsibilities included liaising with technology experts and drafting presentations and drawings. I participated in identity design for the Institute.

Interaction Design Institute Ivrea acts - through its Masters Programme and the innovation projects that are carried out independently or in partnership with Italian and international businesses - as a cultural centre for extending and disseminating interaction design knowledge and know-how. It aims to develop the culture of interaction design, which originally emerged in Silicon Valley, in a European context, building particularly on Italy's heritage and present strengths in design, innovation and lifestyle. In doing this, it will forge a distinctively Italian fusion of culture, technology, service models, and design for products and services.

Selected Projects
 • Lighting Devices • 2005 • Light Fixtures • with Artemide • Milan, Italy
 • Lampscape • 2005 • Proposal for Light Fixtures • Iceland

 • Pixel Materiali • 2005 • Interactive Installation • Museo Degli Innocenti • Florence, Italy
 • Interactive Facade • 2005 • Esselunga Supermarket Chain • Milan, Italy 
 • Interactive Fitting Rooms • 2005 • Accenture • Milan, Italy
